sentences.english: This is an adaptation of another book.
sentences.chinese: 這是另一本書的改寫本。

sentences.english: Change the form of these sentences. Your sentences must begin with the words in italics.
sentences.chinese: 改寫以下句子，將斜體印出的詞和詞組作主語。

sentences.english: "The Matrix" rewrote the text book for movie science fiction.
sentences.chinese: 駭客帝國爲科幻電影重新改寫了教科書。

sentences.english: This means that the related Chinese writing origins the history possibly henceforth rewrites .
sentences.chinese: 這意味着，有關中國文字起源的歷史可能從此改寫。

sentences.english: It overwrites the entries you added earlier.
sentences.chinese: 它將改寫您前面添加的條目。

sentences.english: You can adapt this code for your own applications.
sentences.chinese: 您可以把這段代碼改寫成您自己的應用程序。

sentences.english: The false gods arranged sacred geometry that shattered the 1 billion souls into subservience .
sentences.chinese: 虛假神們改寫了神聖幾何學去粉碎那1億個靈魂。

sentences.english: Using the same verbs, please rewrite these sentences in the passive voice.
sentences.chinese: 請用相同的動詞把這些句子改寫成被動語態的句子。

sentences.english: After several generations, some geniuses are born to rewrite history.
sentences.chinese: 歷經數代之後，一些可以改寫歷史的天才誕生了。

sentences.english: They’re really just stories you tell yourself, but stories can be rewritten.
sentences.chinese: 你對自己說這些應該只是故事，但是故事可以改寫。

sentences.english: They are never rewritten, but re-interpreted on the basis of a changed world.
sentences.chinese: 他們從來改寫，但再次上了一個改變世界的基礎解釋。

sentences.english: You might even think he woulda written it himself.
sentences.chinese: 你甚至會這樣想他會自己改寫。

sentences.english: He recomposed the editorial till dawn.
Rather than judge whether it be redrafted, it was not to return to the secondary deposit.
sentences.chinese: 而不再判斷它是否被改寫過，也不將它寫回到輔存。

sentences.english: We seek to re-write the programming that you have tried to indoctrinate us with since the moment we were born.
sentences.chinese: 我們企圖改寫你們自出生就填鴨式灌輸給我們的規則。

definition: to contrast/to compare/to place side by side for comparison (as parallel texts)/to check
to shake up/to deal a shock/(fig.) to stir (sb's heart)
to expound (a position)/to elaborate (on a topic)/to treat (a subject)
to discuss two disparate things together (idiom); to mention on equal terms/to place on a par with/(often with negatives: impossible to mention X in the same breath as Y)
